body.p:
List of shortcuts in
Shortcut Action
Ctrl+Shift+ENTER (Command+Shift+ENTER on OS X) Moves the cursor to the definition of the referenced XML Schema item.
Ctrl+Click (Command+Click on OS X)
In Text mode, this shortcut takes you to the definition of a reference.
When you have a multiple selection, this shortcut removes the selection from an item.
(Command+Click on OS X) The equivalent of the right click on Windows.
Ctrl+Shift+T (Command+Shift+T on OS X) Opens the Transform with dialog box.
Ctrl+Shift+C (Command+Shift+C on OS X) Opens the Configure Transformation Scenarios dialog box.
Alt+Shift+T, C (Command+Alt+T, C on OS X) Opens the Configure Transformation Scenarios dialog box in .
Alt+Enter When the caret is positioned inside an element, selecting this shortcut edits in place the attributes of the element.
Ctrl+Click (Command+Click on OS X) Make a selection in your document using your caret.
Ctrl+Shift+G (Command+Shift+G on OS X)
Finds the references of the selected element in all the topics of the current DITA Map (the DITA Map opened in the DITA Maps Manager view).
Moves the cursor to the end tag that matches the start tag, or vice versa.
[Syncro SVN Client shortcut] Display a graphical representation of a resource history. For more details about a resource revision graph see the Revision Graph section.
Ctrl+Shift+L (Command+Shift+L on OS X) Learn Structure.
Ctrl+Shift+S (Command+Shift+S on OS X) Save Structure.
Ctrl+N (Command+N on OS X) Opens the New dialog box.
Ctrl+A (Command+A on OS X) Selects the entire content of the editing area.
Enter
In the Author mode, opens the content completion list of proposals.
In the Text mode, move the caret on a new line.
In Grid mode, begins editing and lets you insert a new value. Also commits the changes after you finish editing.
In the Transformation Scenarios view, executes the highlighted scenario.
Esc
Disables the Highlight mode.
Closes the current dialog box.
Tab
Navigates to next XML node.
Shifts the currently selected block to the right.
Shift+Left Click Moves the image in the SVG Viewer.
Ctrl+Right Click (Command+Right Click on OS X) Rotates the image in the SVG Viewer.
Ctrl+I (Command+I on OS X)/Ctrl+O (Command+O on OS X)/Ctrl+Left Click (Command+Left Click on OS X) Zoom in/Zoom out the image in the SVG Viewer
Ctrl+O (Command+O on OS X) Open a document.
Ctrl+T (Command+T on OS X) Resets the dimension of the image.
Shift+Tab
Navigates to the previous XML node.
Shifts the selected block to the left.
Shift Used with the navigation keys, creates a selection area.
Ctrl (Command on OS X) key Ctrl/Command modifier key.
Up Arrow/Page Up Navigates towards the beginning of the document.
Down Arrow/Page Down Navigates towards the ending of the document.
Down Arrow In the Open/Find Resource view/dialog box, moves the selection to the first item in the results list.
Ctrl+Up Arrow (Command+Up Arrow on OS X)
Scrolls the editor up.
In the Open/Find Resource view/dialog box, used in the search field, this shortcut displays the search history.
Ctrl+Down Arrow (Command+Down Arrow on OS X)
Scrolls the editor down.
In the Open/Find Resource view/dialog box, used in the search field, this shortcut displays the search history.
Ctrl+Right Arrow (Command+Right Arrow on OS X) Navigates to the next word.
Ctrl+Left Arrow (Command+Left Arrow on OS X) Navigates to the previous word.
Ctrl+Alt+[ (Command+Alt+[ on OS X) Navigates backwards to the location of the selected text.
Ctrl +Alt+] (Command+Alt+] on OS X) Navigates forward to the location of the selected text.
Ctrl+Alt+G (Command+Alt+G on OS X)l Navigates to the location of the latest edited text.
Ctrl+NumPad +/ (Command+NumPad+/ on OS X) Folds all the elements except the current element.
Ctrl+NumPad + . (Command+NumPad+. on OS X) Folds the elements indented with one level inside the current element.
Ctrl+NumPad + * (Command+NumPad+* on OS X) Unfolds all the elements in the current document.
Ctrl+Home (Command+Home on OS X) Positions the caret at the beginning at the document.
Ctrl+End (Command+End on OS X) Positions the caret at the end of the document.
Ctrl+Shift+O (Command+Shift+O on OS X) In Grid mode, changes the text orientation. The default text orientation is left to right.
NumPad+Plus In Grid mode, expand all the children of a node.
NumPad+Minus In Grid mode, collapses all the children of a node.
Alt+"Letter" On Windows, open the menu access keys.
Ctrl+Space (Command+Space on OS X) Opens the content completion list of proposals.
Ctrl+Shift+Space (Command+Shift+Space on OS X) The code templates shortcut key.
Alt+Up Arrow Moves the selected node in front of their respective previous sibling.
Alt+Down Arrow Moves the selected node after their.
Alt+Left Arrow Promotes the current node.
Alt+Right Arrow Demotes the current node.
Alt+Shift + PageUp Expands all displayed items.
Alt+Shift + PageDown Collapses all displayed items.
Ctrl+Shift+] (Command+Shift+] on OS X) Navigate to the next message.
Ctrl+Shift+[ (Command+Shift+[ on OS X) Navigate to the previous message.
Ctrl+F (Command+F on OS X) Opens the Find/Replace dialog box.
Alt+Shift+R Rename the current XML schema element.
Alt+Shift+P Renames the prefix of the current element.
F1 Opens the documentation.
F2 Renames resources in the NavigatorProject view.
F3 Used for performing another search using the last search configuration
Shift+F3 Used for performing another search in backward direction using the last search configuration.
Shift+Delete In the Project view, removes the selected resource from disk.
Ctrl+Z (Command+Z on OS X) Undo change.
Ctrl+Y (Command+Z on OS X) Redo change.
Ctrl+S (Command+S on OS X) Save change.
Ctrl+Alt+H (Command+Alt+H on OS X) Compare with latest from Head.
Ctrl+Shift+L (Command+Shift+L on OS X) Learn structure.
Ctrl+Shift+S (Command+Shift+S on OS X) Save structure.
Ctrl+. (Command+. on OS X) Go to the next error in the Problems view.
Ctrl+, (Command+, on OS X) Go to the previous error in the Problems view.
Ctrl+NumPad+"+" (Command+NumPad+"+" on OS X) or Ctrl+Scroll Forward (Command+Scroll Forward on OS X )
Increases the font size with one point for each execution of the action.
Ctrl+NumPad+"-" (Command+NumPad+"-" on OS X) or Ctrl+Scroll Backwards (Command+Scroll Backwards on OS X) Decreases the font size with one point for each execution of the action.
Ctrl+"+" (Command+"+" on OS X) Increases the font size with one point for each execution of the action. In Grid mode it zooms in.
Ctrl+"-" (Command+"-" on OS X) Decreases the font size with one point for each execution of the action. In Grid mode it zooms out.
Ctrl+0 (Command+0 on OS X) or Ctrl+NumPad + 0 (Command+NumPad+0 on OS X) Resets the font size to the value of the editor font set in the Preferences pages.
Ctrl+Shift+F4 (Command+Shift+F4 on OS X) Makes the current dockable view invisible.
Ctrl+Alt+. (Command+Alt+. on OS X) Copies the XPath expression of the current element or attribute from the current editor to the clipboard.
Ctrl+Shift+. (Command+Shift+. on OS X) Copies the XPath expression of the current element or attribute from the current editor to the clipboard. (Eclipse plugin)
Ctrl+] (Command+] on OS X) Moves the cursor to the end of the next tag.
Ctrl+[ (Command+[ on OS X) Moves the cursor to the end of the previous tag.
Ctrl+Shift+E (Command+Shift+E on OS X)
Opens the Find All Elements / Attributes dialog box.
Ctrl+Enter (Command+Enter on OS X)
Allows you to input multiple lines in the Text to find and Replace with fields of the Find/Replace dialog box.
inserts both the start and end tags and positions the cursor between the tags, so you can start typing content.
Opens the URL at caret position.
Ctrl+Alt+N (Command+Alt+N on OS X) [Syncro SVN Client shortcut] Displays the Add SVN Repository dialog.
Ctrl+Alt+E (Command+Alt+E on OS X) [Syncro SVN Client shortcut] Context-depended action that allows you to edit the selected repository location using the Edit SVN Repository dialog. It is active only when a repository location root is selected.
Ctrl+Alt+Shift+B (Command+Alt+Shift+B on OS X) [Syncro SVN Client shortcut] Context-dependent action that allows you to change the selected repository revision using the Change the Revision to Browse dialog. It is active only when a repository root location is selected.
Ctrl+Alt+Shift+R (Command+Alt+Shift+R on OS X) [Syncro SVN Client shortcut] Allows you to remove the selected repository location from the view. It displays a confirmation dialog box before removal. It is active only when a repository root location is selected.
Ctrl+Alt+Shift+C (Command+Alt+Shift+C on OS X) [Syncro SVN Client shortcut] Allows you to create a working copy from a repository directory, on your local file system. To read more about this operation, see the Check out a working copy section.
Ctrl+Alt+Shift+M (Command+Alt+Shift+M on OS X) [Syncro SVN Client shortcut] Depending on the selected folder form the repository, allows you to import the contents of a specified folder from the file system into it. To read more about this operation, see the Importing resources into a repository section.
Ctrl+Alt+I (Command+Alt+I on OS X) [Syncro SVN Client shortcut] Imports the files selected from the files system in the selected folder from the repository.
Ctrl+H (Command+H on OS X) [Syncro SVN Client shortcut] Displays the history of the selected resource. When the operation starts you are able to set filtering options.
Ctrl+Shift+A (Command+Shift+A on OS X) [Syncro SVN Client shortcut]
Opens the selected resource in the Annotations panel;
Displays corresponding annotations list in the Annotations view;
Displays the history of the selected resource.
Ctrl+Shift+U (Command+Shift+U on OS X)
[Syncro SVN Client shortcut] Copies to clipboard the URL location of the selected resource.
Highlight component occurrences.
Ctrl+M (Command+M on OS X) [Syncro SVN Client shortcut] Moves to a specified location the currently selected resource(s).
Ctrl+K (Command+K on OS X) [Syncro SVN Client shortcut] Allows you to lock certain files for which you need exclusive access.
Ctrl+Shift+K (Command+Shift+K on OS X) [Syncro SVN Client shortcut] Releases the exclusive access to a file from the repository.
Ctrl+Shift+P (Command+Shift+P on OS X) [Syncro SVN Client shortcut] Displays the Properties view revealing the SVN properties for the selected resources.
Ctrl+I (Command+I on OS X)
[Syncro SVN Client shortcut] Provides additional information for the selected resource.
Corrects the indentation of the selected block of lines
Ctrl+Shift+I Pretty prints the element that surrounds the caret position.
Alt+Shift+C (Command+Alt+C on OS X) Generate/Convert Schema
Ctrl+Shift+"\" (Command+Shift+"\" on OS X) Generate/Convert Schema (Eclipse)
Ctrl+Shift+Y (Command+Shift+Y on OS X) Enables line wrapping in the editor panel if it was off and vice versa.
Ctrl+P (Command+P on OS X) Displays the page setup.
Alt+Shift+F (Command+Shift+F on OS X) Displays the Quick Find toolbar.
Ctrl+Tab (Command+Tab on OS X) Switches between the tabs with opened files in the order most recent ones first.
Ctrl+Alt+U (Command+Alt+U on OS X) Copies to clipboard the URL location of the selected resource.
Ctrl+Delete (Command+Delete on OS X) Deletes the next word.
Ctrl+Backspace (Command+Backspace on OS X) Deletes the previous word.
Ctrl+W (Command+W on OS X)
Cuts the previous word.
Closes the selected editor tab.
Ctrl+K (Command+K on OS X) Cuts to end of line.
Alt+Shift+Enter Allows you to edit the attributes of the selected component.
Ctrl+X (Command+X on OS X) Cut.
Ctrl+C (Command+C on OS X) Copy.
Ctrl+V (Command+V on OS X) Paste.
Ctrl +Shift+Tab (Command+Shift+Tab on OS X) Switches between the tabs with opened files in the reverse order.
Ctrl+E (Command + E on OS X) Allows you to choose a tag that encloses a selected portion of content.
Alt+Shift+E (Command+Alt+E on OS X) Allows you to choose a tag that encloses a selected portion of content (Eclipse).
Ctrl+/ (Command+/ on OS X)
Inserts the last tag used by the Surround with tag... action.
Toggle comment.
Alt+Shift+/ (Command+Alt+/ on OS X) Inserts the last tag used by the Surround with tag... action (Eclipse).
Command+Alt+R on OS X The element from the caret position and the elements that have the same name as the current element can be renamed according with the options from the Rename dialog.
Command+Alt+P on OS X The prefix of the element from the caret position and the elements that have the same prefix as the current element can be renamed according with the options from the Rename dialog.
Ctrl+Alt+D Split the element from the caret position in two identical elements.
Ctrl+Alt+J Joins the left and right elements relative to the current caret position.
Alt+Shift+F (Command+Alt+F on OS X) Joins the left and right elements relative to the current caret position (Eclipse).
Ctrl+Alt+X (Command+Alt+X on Mac OS)
Deletes the start and end tag of the current element.
Generate XSLT documentation.
Alt+Shift+, (Cmd+Alt+, on OS X) Deletes the start and end tag of the current element (Eclipse).
Ctrl+Shift+R (Command+Shift+R on OS X) Searches all references of the item found at current cursor position in the defined scope.
Ctrl+Shift+W (Command+Shift+W on OS X) Check Well-Formedness of an XML document.
Alt+Shift+V, W (Cmd+Alt+V, W on OS X) Check Well-Formedness of an XML document. (Eclipse)
Ctrl+F4 (Command+F4 on OS X) Closes the currently focused editor.
F7 XSLT debugger step into.
F8 (Alt+F7 on OS X) XSLT debugger step over.
Shift+F7 XSLT debugger step out.
Ctrl+F5 (Command+F5 on OS X) XSLT debugger run to cursor.
Alt+F5 XSLT debugger run to end.
Shift+F6 XSLT debugger pause.
F6 XSLT debugger stop.
Ctrl+F6 (Command+F6 on OS X) Switch between open files.
Ctrl+Shift+F6 (Command+Shift+F6 on OS X) Switch between open files.
Ctrl+Alt+Y Toggle fold.
Alt + 1 (Meta + Alt + 1 on OS X) Quick Fix/Assist Stand Alone
Ctrl + 1 Quick Fix/Assist Eclipse
